intro: Euphrasia villaricensis, commonly known as the Villaricencian eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and thrives in open, sunny habitats. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine, downy hairs. Euphrasia villaricensis is often found in mountainous regions and is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
